podcast.name: 60-Second Science
podcast.description: Tune in every weekday for quick reports and commentaries on the world of science—it'll just take a minute

podcast_episode.title: How Vaccines Saved Money and Lives, and China's Zero-COVID Protests: COVID, Quickly Podcast, Episode 44
podcast_episode.name: How Vaccines Saved Money and Lives, and China's Zero-COVID Protests: COVID, Quickly Podcast, Episode 44
podcast_episode.description: <p>Vaccines saved New York City billions of dollars, and China faces public fury over its strict virus-control policies.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - How Vaccines Saved Money and Lives, and China's Zero-COVID Protests: COVID, Quickly Podcast, Episode 44.

podcast_episode.title: 'Chatty Turtles' Flip the Script on the Evolutionary Origins of Vocalization in Animals
podcast_episode.name: 'Chatty Turtles' Flip the Script on the Evolutionary Origins of Vocalization in Animals
podcast_episode.description: <p>Recordings of more than 50 species of turtles and other animals help scientists reassess the origins of acoustic communication in vertebrates.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - 'Chatty Turtles' Flip the Script on the Evolutionary Origins of Vocalization in Animals.

podcast_episode.title: Tardigrades, an Unlikely Sleeping Beauty
podcast_episode.name: Tardigrades, an Unlikely Sleeping Beauty
podcast_episode.description: <p>Researchers put this ancient critter through a subzero gauntlet to learn more about what happens to their internal clock while surviving the extreme.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Tardigrades, an Unlikely Sleeping Beauty.

podcast_episode.title: A Burned Redwood Forest Tells a Story of Climate Change, Past, Present and Future
podcast_episode.name: A Burned Redwood Forest Tells a Story of Climate Change, Past, Present and Future
podcast_episode.description: <p>From the ashes of the giants of Big Basin Redwoods State Park arise a history of fire suppression and real questions about what happens to the forests in a drought-stricken West Coast going forward.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A Burned Redwood Forest Tells a Story of Climate Change, Past, Present and Future.

podcast_episode.title: Antivirals Could Reduce Long COVID Risk and How Well the New Boosters Work: COVID, Quickly Podcast, Episode 43
podcast_episode.name: Antivirals Could Reduce Long COVID Risk and How Well the New Boosters Work: COVID, Quickly Podcast, Episode 43
podcast_episode.description: <p>In this new episode of our coronavirus podcast, we discuss a study that looked at the effects of Paxlovid on long COVID symptoms, and we also talk new bivalent boosters and immunity.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Antivirals Could Reduce Long COVID Risk and How Well the New Boosters Work: COVID, Quickly Podcast, Episode 43.

podcast_episode.title: A Honeybee Swarm Has as Much Electric Charge as a Thundercloud
podcast_episode.name: A Honeybee Swarm Has as Much Electric Charge as a Thundercloud
podcast_episode.description: <p>New research shows that bees “buzz” in more than the way you might think.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - A Honeybee Swarm Has as Much Electric Charge as a Thundercloud.

podcast_episode.title: These Punk Rock Penguins Have a Bizarre Breeding Strategy
podcast_episode.name: These Punk Rock Penguins Have a Bizarre Breeding Strategy
podcast_episode.description: <p>New Zealand’s erect-crested penguin lays two eggs but rejects the first one—the opposite of how most birds prioritize their offspring.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - These Punk Rock Penguins Have a Bizarre Breeding Strategy.

podcast_episode.title: The Viral Triple Threat and Why You Need a Booster: COVID, Quickly, Episode 42
podcast_episode.name: The Viral Triple Threat and Why You Need a Booster: COVID, Quickly, Episode 42
podcast_episode.description: <p>COVID, flu and RSV are surging. Here’s what you need to know to protect yourself.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - The Viral Triple Threat and Why You Need a Booster: COVID, Quickly, Episode 42.

podcast_episode.title: What You Need to Know about Iran's Surveillance Tech
podcast_episode.name: What You Need to Know about Iran's Surveillance Tech
podcast_episode.description: <p><em>Scientific American</em> technology editor Sophie Bushwick explains how Iran is using surveillance tech against vulnerable citizens.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - What You Need to Know about Iran's Surveillance Tech.

podcast_episode.title: Delivering Equitable Lung Cancer Care [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.name: Delivering Equitable Lung Cancer Care [Sponsored]
podcast_episode.description: <p>As recent advances improve the prospects of detecting and catching lung cancer early, a new challenge arises: how to ensure people worldwide, regardless of their socioeconomic circumstances, benefit from new clinical tools.</p>
podcast_episode.filename: 60-Second Science - Delivering Equitable Lung Cancer Care [Sponsored].

podcast.name: Plays Well with Others
podcast.description: From Creative Commons, a podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley.

podcast_episode.title: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.name: What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - What Do an Army of Ants and an Online Encyclopedia Have in Common?.m4a

podcast_episode.title: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.name: I Laughed So Hard I Cried
podcast_episode.filename: Plays Well with Others - I Laughed So Hard I Cried.m4a

podcast_episode.title: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.name: Coming Soon
podcast_episode.description: <p>From Creative Commons, a new podcast about the art and science of collaboration. With a focus on the tools, techniques, and mechanics of collaboration, we’re going to explore how today's most interesting collaborators are making new things, solving old problems, and getting things done — together. Hosted by Creative Commons CEO Ryan Merkley. Premieres Tuesday, February 19.</p>
